description.S: Apple Inc. designs, manufactures and markets mobile communication and media devices, personal computers and portable digital music players. The Company sells a range of related software, services, accessories, networking solutions, and third-party digital content and applications. The Company's segments include the Americas, Europe, Greater China, Japan and Rest of Asia Pacific. The Americas segment includes both North and South America. The Europe segment includes European countries, India, the Middle East and Africa. The Greater China segment includes China, Hong Kong and Taiwan. The Rest of Asia Pacific segment includes Australia and the Asian countries not included in the Company's other operating segments. Its products and services include iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod, Apple Watch, Apple TV, a portfolio of consumer and professional software applications, iPhone OS (iOS), OS X and watchOS operating systems, iCloud, Apple Pay and a range of accessory, service and support offerings. x

financial_summary.S: BRIEF: For the 27 weeks ended 01 April 2017, Apple Inc. revenues increased 4% to $131.25B. Net income increased less than 1% to $28.92B. Revenues reflect Americas- Operating segment increase of 10% to $53.13B, Europe-Operating segment increase of 6% to $31.25B. Net income reflects Americas- Operating segment income increase of 6% to $17.16B, Japan-Operating segment income increase of 13% to $4.71B.

name.S: Executive Vice President - Worldwide Sales and Operations
Senior Vice President - Worldwide Operations, Sales, Service and Support
Chief Financial Officer, Senior Vice President, Principal Accounting Officer
Senior Vice President, General Counsel, Secretary
Senior Vice President - Retail and Online Stores
Senior Vice President - Internet Software and Services

equity_composition.S: Common Stock no Par, 4/11, 1.80B auth., 924,754,561 issd. Insiders control less than 0.06%. PO: 5/81, 2.6M shares @ $31.25 by Morgan Stanley & Co. 2/05, 6/00 & 5/87, 2-for-1 stock splits. 1/07, Name changed from Apple Computer, Inc. 06/14, 7-for-1 Stock split.
